alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 4:43PM EDT until August 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd, Knott and Pike. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Up to 0.5 inches of additional rainfall is possible over the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Estill, Wayland, East McDowell, Blue Moon, McDowell, Drift, Minnie, Craynor, Orkney, Honaker, Hunter, Grethel, Printer, Aluba, Galveston, Osborn, Harold, Demo and Langley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
